nio/SignalTimeout.description: The SignalTimeout block will emit a timeout signal when no signals have been processed for the defined `intervals`. A timeout signal is the last signal to enter the block with an added `group` attribute that specifies the group (default `None`) and a `timeout` attribute that is a python `datetime.timedelta` specifying the configured `interval` that triggered the signal.

backup_interval.title: Backup Interval
backup_interval.description: An interval of time that specifies how often persisted data is saved.

group_by.title: Group By
group_by.description: The signal attribute on the incoming signal whose values will be used to define groups on the outgoing signal.

intervals.title: Timeout Intervals
intervals.description: After a signal, if another one does not enter the block for this amount of time, emit a timeout signal.

load_from_persistence.title: Load from Persistence?
load_from_persistence.description: When stopped, the last signal for each group is saved if the group still has active jobs (one or more interval has not yet timed out). When started, if `load_from_persistence` is `True`, saved signals will be processed, starting all configured timeout intervals for that group.

default.description: The last signal to enter the block with additional attributes **timeout** and **group**.

groups.description: Display the active groups tracked by the block
